docs.snippet: The Academy's switch to 10 nominees for best picture is getting traction beyond awards season bloggers, as this past weekend's "Saturday Night Live" demonstrated....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a sure sign that the Academy's switch to 10 nominees for best picture is getting traction beyond awards-season bloggers, check out this past weekend's "Saturday Night Live," in which the expanded field went even further. Among those making the new, more liberal cut: "Old Dogs" and "Jersey Shore.") The show also poked fun at "Avatar," with Sigourney Weaver reprising her role as a smoking scientist and Bill Hader playing Sam Worthington, really making the most of his Na'vi body.
docs.abstract: The Academy's switch to 10 nominees for best picture is getting traction beyond awards season bloggers, as this past weekend's "Saturday Night Live" demonstrated.

headline.main: And the Oscar Goes to ... 'Old Dogs'?

docs.snippet: That was indeed Jeff Bridges's voice you heard in those Hyundai commercials during the Super Bowl, in which the best actor nominee for "Crazy Heart" plugged the Sonata and its amazing warranty....
docs.lead_paragraph: In other movie-ad news, that was indeed Jeff Bridges's voice you heard in those Hyundai commercials during the Super Bowl, in which that best-actor nominee for "Crazy Heart" plugged the Sonata and its amazing warranty. Though the nitpicky Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences has a longstanding rule against its nominees being featured in ads within one hour of their appearance on the Oscar telecast, it has still decided to work with Hyundai, its largest advertiser this year, reports Steve Pond at TheWrap.com. (Hyundai will have nine commercial spots on the Oscars next month, at an estimated $1.4 million for each 30-second ad.)
docs.abstract: That was indeed Jeff Bridges's voice you heard in those Hyundai commercials during the Super Bowl, in which the best actor nominee for "Crazy Heart" plugged the Sonata and its amazing warranty.

headline.main: Best Voice-Over in a Car Commercial

docs.snippet: Pixar has long complained that Jeffrey Katzenberg's DreamWorks has an unfair advantage at the International Animated Film Society awards....
docs.lead_paragraph: Animators can be a tricky bunch. On one hand, they are generally dorky and polite, guys (and overwhelmingly so) who offer an aw-shucks counterbalance to the preening of the rest of Hollywood. But animators can get really, really cranky when it comes to the public lauding - or not - of their work.
docs.abstract: Pixar has long complained that Jeffrey Katzenberg's DreamWorks has an unfair advantage at the International Animated Film Society awards.

docs.snippet: 8 P.M. (HBO) TEMPLE GRANDIN (2010) Claire Danes, left, plays Ms. Grandin, the autistic animal behaviorist whose designs for humane slaughterhouses are used in the cattle industry. ''I'm not like other people,'' she has said. ''I think in pictures....
docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (HBO) TEMPLE GRANDIN (2010) Claire Danes, left, plays Ms. Grandin, the autistic animal behaviorist whose designs for humane slaughterhouses are used in the cattle industry. ''I'm not like other people,'' she has said. ''I think in pictures.'' Mick Jackson directed this film, using a series of snapshot images that trace Ms. Grandin's self-perceptions from her early diagnosis through her turbulent school years and the unwavering support of her mother (Julia Ormond), aunt (Catherine O'Hara) and science teacher (David Strathairn). ''Hers is a tale that could be easily played up for drama, intrigue and weepy reconciliations, but this narrative is loyal to Ms. Grandin's credo: emotions are secondary to tangible results,'' Alessandra Stanley wrote in The New York Times. ''And the result is a movie that is funny, instructive and also intangibly charming.'' 10:30 A.M. (13) RELIGION & ETHICS NEWSWEEKLY Kim Lawton explores how Haitian and Dominican churches are putting aside historic tensions to lead earthquake relief efforts. The author Mitch Albom discusses the New Jersey rabbi and Detroit pastor who inspired his latest book, ''Have a Little Faith.'' And Bob Abernethy and Ms. Lawton report on the 10 Americans, most of them members of an Idaho Baptist congregation, who have been charged in Haiti with child abduction and criminal conspiracy for trying to take 33 Haitian children out of the country on Jan. 29 without the government's consent.
